BERTS2S: ireland lost to afghanistan in the second of the three-match twenty20 series in india on tuesday.
BERTS2S_lines: ireland lost to afghanistan in the second of the three-match twenty20 series in india on tuesday.
TConvS2S: ireland reached the semi-finals of the intercontinental cup with a six-wicket victory over afghanistan in the intercontinental cup in dubai.
TConvS2S_lines: ireland reached the semi-finals of the intercontinental cup with a six-wicket victory over afghanistan in the intercontinental cup in dubai.
PtGen: ireland ran in nine tries as they beat afghanistan in the final of the first twenty20 international in afghanistan.
PtGen_lines: ireland ran in nine tries as they beat afghanistan in the final of the first twenty20 international in afghanistan.
TranS2S: afghanistan beat ireland by 46 runs in the one-day twenty20 international in nagpur.
TranS2S_lines: afghanistan beat ireland by 46 runs in the one-day twenty20 international in nagpur.
article: Opener Stuart Thompson hit 56 while Gary Wilson (41 no) and captain William Porterfield (39) added valuable runs as Ireland made 165-5 in Greater Noida.It was not enough with Samiullah Shenwari (56) and Mohammad Shahzad (47) helping the Afghans to 171-4 with two overs to spare.The sides meet again in the second T20 at the same venue on Friday.Ireland suffered an early blow when opener Paul Stirling was dismissed for a duck and with just one run on the board.Thompson and Porterfield steadied the innings before Wilson helped the Irish to a competitive total.Shahzad and Najeeb Tarakai (27) put on an opening stand of 51 as Afghanistan cruised to their victory target.Afghan spinner Amir Hamza (2-23) was the only bowler to take more than one wicket on a day when the bat dominated."We fell a little bit short of potentially a very big score. We could have added another 15 and gotten up to the 180 we were looking for," said Porterfield."As well as we played I thought we just came up short with the ball. We didn't quite execute things as well as we would have liked."The loss of paceman Boyd Rankin for the T20s, because of a back problem, was another setback for the Irish on Wednesday.Rankin is expected to return for the five ODIs against Afghanistan, starting on 15 March.
article_lines: Opener Stuart Thompson hit 56 while Gary Wilson (41 no) and captain William Porterfield (39) added valuable runs as Ireland made 165-5 in Greater Noida.
It was not enough with Samiullah Shenwari (56) and Mohammad Shahzad (47) helping the Afghans to 171-4 with two overs to spare.
The sides meet again in the second T20 at the same venue on Friday.
Ireland suffered an early blow when opener Paul Stirling was dismissed for a duck and with just one run on the board.
Thompson and Porterfield steadied the innings before Wilson helped the Irish to a competitive total.
Shahzad and Najeeb Tarakai (27) put on an opening stand of 51 as Afghanistan cruised to their victory target.
Afghan spinner Amir Hamza (2-23) was the only bowler to take more than one wicket on a day when the bat dominated.
"We fell a little bit short of potentially a very big score.
We could have added another 15 and gotten up to the 180 we were looking for," said Porterfield.
well as we played I thought we just came up short with the ball.
We didn't quite execute things as well as we would have liked.
loss of paceman Boyd Rankin for the T20s, because of a back problem, was another setback for the Irish on Wednesday.
Rankin is expected to return for the five ODIs against Afghanistan, starting on 15 March.
traps: shahzad and najeeb tarakai (27) put on an opening stand of 51 as afghanistan cruised to its victory target.
you didn't quite execute things as well as we would have liked.
loss of paceman boyd rankin for the t20s , because of a back problem , was not another setback for the irish on wednesday .
ireland suffered an early blow when opener paul stirling was not dismissed for a duck and with just one run on the board .
opener stuart thompson hit 56 while gary wilson (41 no) and captain william porterfield (39) added valuable runs as ireland made 165-5 in greater noida.
reference: ireland started the three-match t20 series against afghanistan with a six-wicket defeat in india on wednesday.
